subject: Career
title: Using Precise Numbers
description: A micro-lesson that makes Using Precise Numbers usable.

hook.text: Asking for $103,500 is more effective than asking for $100,000. Precision signals preparation.

buildup.text: Columbia research found precise numbers are perceived as more informed and harder to counter.

discovery.text: Round numbers feel arbitrary. Precise numbers feel calculated â€” like they're backed by data.

twist.text: The trick works both ways. If someone offers you $100K flat, they likely haven't done deep analysis.

climax.text: Prepare your precise number before the conversation. Derive it from market data, not guesswork.

punchline.text: Precise numbers win because they look researched.

quiz.question: Why are precise salary numbers more effective than round ones?
options: They signal research and are harder to counter
